newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish shares post modest gains ahead of weekend.
newsitem.headline: Turkish shares post modest gains ahead of weekend.

text.p: Turkish shares posted modest gains on Friday amid improving volumes, recouping losses a week earlier on signs of a gradual return of confidence, brokers said.
The IMKB-100 rose 1.25 percent or 803.46 points to end at 64,982.24. Gains this week have totalled 4.21 percent after losses of 4.16 percent last week.
Daily volume rose to 8.4 trillion ($97.3 million) from Thursday's 7.2 trillion lira ($83.3 million).
"Some money is flowing into the market as speculators slowly return after withdrawing from the market after formation of the government," said the deputy securities chief at Disbank, Nazmi Sarikaya.
Sarikaya said gains were held back by resistance at the 65,000-65,200 index level.
